Package geometries

Class Polygon

java.lang.Object
geometries.Intersectable
geometries.Geometry
geometries.Polygon
Direct Known Subclasses:
Triangle
public class Polygon
extends Geometry
Polygon class represents two-dimensional polygon in 3D Cartesian coordinate system

  • Constructor Details

    • Polygon

      public Polygon​(Color emissionLight, Material material, Point3D... vertices)
      Polygon constructor based on vertices list. The list must be ordered by edge path. The polygon must be convex.
      Parameters:
      emissionLight - for color of polygon
      material - for material attributes of polygon
      vertices - list of vertices according to their order by edge path
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in any case of illegal combination of vertices:
      • Less than 3 vertices
      • Consequent vertices are in the same point
      • The vertices are not in the same plane
      • The order of vertices is not according to edge path
      • Three consequent vertices lay in the same line (180° angle between two consequent edges)
      • The polygon is concave (not convex)

    • Polygon

      public Polygon​(Color emissionLight, Point3D... vertices)
      constructor. material gets default value
      Parameters:
      emissionLight - for color of polygon
      vertices - list of vertices according to their order by edge path

    • Polygon

      public Polygon​(Point3D... vertices)

  • Method Details

    • getNormal

      public Vector getNormal​(Point3D point)
      Description copied from class: Geometry
      Calculate a unit vector orthogonal to the surface or the geometry body at the given point. Basic assumption - the point lays in the surface
      Specified by:
      getNormal in class Geometry
      Parameters:
      point - in the surface
      Returns:
      unit orthogonal vector

    • findIntersections

      protected java.util.List<Intersectable.GeoPoint> findIntersections​(Ray ray, double max)
      Parameters:
      ray - that intersect the polygon
      max - the maximum range from the source of the ray to the point
      Returns:
      a list of the intersect points
